most_active_tickets.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked

common_issues.title: Constant selection, like stuck "shift" or "mouse 1"
common_issues.description: Users on Pieces OS 4.3.1 for Windows experience continuous selection, as if "shift" or "mouse 1" is permanently pressed. This affects arrow key navigation and clicking, turning them into selection actions.  Copy-pasting (ctrl+v) is also disabled during this bug. The trigger is currently unknown.

related_issues.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
related_issues.text:
it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not sure how to make it happen but its **extremely** annoying, it seems like it thinks I'm holding "shift" or "mouse 1", i use the arrow keys a lot but when this bug is active it selects instead of moving, when i try to click when its active it also selects, i cant ctrl + v when its active :(

recommendations: Investigate the "constant selection" bug affecting Pieces OS 4.3.1 on Windows.  Prioritize this issue due to its high frequency and negative impact on user experience.
Gather more data on how to reproduce the "constant selection" bug. The current report lacks clear reproduction steps, making it difficult for developers to address.
Update support documentation with workarounds or temporary solutions for the "constant selection" bug while a permanent fix is being developed.
Consider increasing test coverage for Pieces OS 4.3.1 on Windows to catch similar issues in the future.
